oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Tumaco La Tolita human figurine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: La Tolita
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian ceramic figure depicting a higher status person. The figure is adorned with an appliqué collar and a headdress. The figure has narrowed eyes and a large nose. Also, there is some evidence that this figure once had red pigment on it due to staining on different parts.
The figure is broken at both arms and its left leg. There is also chipping at the foot and headdress. Other than those things the figure is in fairly good condition.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
